intro: Carex turczaninofii, commonly known as the Turczaninov’s sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, three-ranked spikelets. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and cooler climates. It typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, forming dense clumps that can spread via rhizomes. The plant is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
